Class SalesDatabase

java.lang.Object
SalesDatabase
public class SalesDatabase extends Object
This class allows filtering unique records from within each file in a directory tree and writes the filtered records to outputFile
Author:
mukeshangrish

    Constructor
    Description
    SalesDatabase()

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static void
    addRecords(Sales s)
    adds a new sales record to the salesArr of the SalesDatabase class if the record does not already exist
    static int
    binarySaleSearch(long order_ID)
    finds the index of a sales record in the salesArr[] using binary search
    static void
    displayFileContents(FileInputStream file)
    displays the files content line by line
    static void
    listAllFiles(File dir, File logFile)
    recursively explores the directory and sub-directories and lists all directories and files in the logFile file
    static void
    main(String[] args)
    allows the user to log all files from a Data folder to a log file and then filters the unique records from each file and writes them to an output file
    static void
    processFile(File file, File exceptionLogFile, File outputFile)
    reads a valid file, creates a Sales object for each line, and adds the Sales object to the salesArr[] using addRecords() method also writes the contents to outputFile
    static int
    sequentialSaleSearch(long order_ID)
    finds the index of a sales record in the salesArr[] using sequential search

  • Method Details

    • listAllFiles

      public static void listAllFiles(File dir, File logFile) throws IOException
      recursively explores the directory and sub-directories and lists all directories and files in the logFile file
      Parameters:
      dir - the directory to be explored
      logFile - the file to be written to
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs, usually due to an invalid file

    • addRecords

      public static void addRecords(Sales s) throws DuplicateRecordException
      adds a new sales record to the salesArr of the SalesDatabase class if the record does not already exist
      Parameters:
      s - the sales record to be added
      Throws:
      DuplicateRecordException - if the record already exists

    • displayFileContents

      public static void displayFileContents(FileInputStream file) throws IOException
      displays the files content line by line
      Parameters:
      file - the file to be read
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs, usually due to an invalid file

    • binarySaleSearch

      public static int binarySaleSearch(long order_ID)
      finds the index of a sales record in the salesArr[] using binary search
      Parameters:
      order_ID - the order_ID of the sales record to be searched for
      Returns:
      the index of the order_ID in the salesArr[]

    • sequentialSaleSearch

      public static int sequentialSaleSearch(long order_ID)
      finds the index of a sales record in the salesArr[] using sequential search
      Parameters:
      order_ID - the order_ID of the sales record to be searched for
      Returns:
      the index of the order_ID in the salesArr[]

    • processFile

      public static void processFile(File file, File exceptionLogFile, File outputFile) throws IOException
      reads a valid file, creates a Sales object for each line, and adds the Sales object to the salesArr[] using addRecords() method also writes the contents to outputFile
      Parameters:
      file - the file to be read
      exceptionLogFile - the file to write the exceptions to
      outputFile - the file to write the contents to
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs, usually due to an invalid file

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      allows the user to log all files from a Data folder to a log file and then filters the unique records from each file and writes them to an output file
      Parameters:
      args - the command line arguments (not used)
